definitions.definition: The infliction of severe pain or anguish , especially as an interrogation technique or punishment ; ( usually in the plural ) a technique , method , or device which is designed to inflict such anguish.
examples: People confess to anything under torture .
Using large dogs to attack bound, hand-cuffed prisoners is clearly torture .

definitions.definition: Severe pain or anguish, of mind or body.
An unpleasant sensation or its infliction: embarrassment , heartache , etc.
examples: Every time she says 'goodbye' it is torture !

main_definition: The infliction of severe pain or anguish , especially as an interrogation technique or punishment ; ( usually in the plural ) a technique , method , or device which is designed to inflict such anguish.
secondary_definitions: Severe pain or anguish, of mind or body.
( in figurative or extended use ) An unpleasant sensation or its infliction: embarrassment , heartache , etc.
